description: Second-semester music majors continue formal musicianship studies. Students perform
advanced rhythms and increasingly chromatic melodies at sight. Students analyze and
compose Western tonal music that employs modal mixture, Neapolitan chords,
augmented-sixth chords, and remote modulations, all of which are closely integrated into
melodic and harmonic dictations. Students analyze the principle movement-length forms.
Class meets four times weekly. Offered annually in the fall semester. Prerequisite: MUSIC 114.
